TopicTitle: How do I tell which mod is doing a memory leak, or if it's having a memory leak?

Articles.Content:
What the question says, and besides trial and error by putting things into the near-stock branch. I'm trying to reproduce a memory leak that I've had with Moho and Ike on a near-stock branch install but it doesn't seem to be happening and I've got lots of mods on the main save.

Edit: I do have GCmonitor, so theres that.

Edit2: Okay..... I'm not seeing the memory leak on Ike. I suspect maybe something with the heating overlay?..........

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-30T22:33:32Z" title="05/30/2015 10:33  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 30, 2015</time> by smjjames**

The heating overlay is (in 1.0.2, supposed to be fixed in 1.0.3) a known source of a memory leak. There's some kind of edge-highlighting option that can be disabled to prevent it from leaking, or it can be disabled manually via Mod+F10 (or just F10, I forget which), or with e.g. [Temperature Gauge Killer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120731).

While this is likely the PPFX edge highlighting bug, for future reference the way to tell is to do a binary search.

If using CKAN you can import/export your installed mods list, that makes things easier.

1. Anyway, make a list of your currently installed mods. 

2. Remove half. 

3. Test for the bug. 

4a. If it's present, go to step 1. (or stop if there's only 1 mod left). 

4b. If it's not present, swap halves and go to step 1.

Since each step removes half the mods it's an efficient search.
PPFX is disabled anyway because the hardware doesn't support it, and I don't use CKAN.

> 
> PPFX is disabled anyway because the hardware doesn't support it, and I don't use CKAN.

CKAN just makes listing your mods (and ensuring library mods don't get uninstalled) easier, it's totally unnecessary for doing a binary search.
